reviewText: I guess there's a little too much late-'80s-early-'90s in this DVD...Wife thought it was no challenge and got annoyed with it fast. I guess if you are a more active "preggo" you might want to check out some of the other options! ;D
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm not particularly a big fan of Denise.  A bit too perky for my taste but I'm trying to have variety with my pregnancy workouts.  The big flaw in this video, for me, in this workout is that it feels rushed.  Especially during the toning section.  We do a couple of these...next!...a couple of these...next!...and a couple of these...next!  I know I'm pregnant but I still would like a thorough workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I thought the dvd was fairly good.  The exercises are safe and well-explained.  I think Denise is her typical enthusiastic/annoying self.  Probably a good tape to do but not overly challenging.
summary: review for fit and firm pregnancy

reviewText: It's hard enough to get into a fitness routine as a beginner but, add pregnancy to the mix and it's a whole new ballgame!  This is a really great workout for the beginner and it's very energizing.  Highly recommend this!

reviewText: This dvd is kind of aged. It seems like it was filmed in the 80's. It didn't provide a fun filled workout for me.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is good for moms who are not used to exercising before pregnancy.  I am a regular exerciser, but I find this one is my best option on days I am extra tired or those days I just plain don't feel like exercising.  Denise is upbeat and friendly and the choreography is simple, though repetitive.  The workout goes by quickly and makes me feel good that I've done something healthy for myself and my baby on a day I may have rather laid back down on the couch.  Unfailingly, I have more energy afterwards and can carry on about my daily activities a little easier.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Denise is perky and annoying, and the workout looks like something from 1980.  And it really isn't much of a workout either.  I put it in for 15 minutes and had to stop the video, it was too ridiculous, and I felt really stupid doing such awkward moves.  Do yourself a favor and spend a little bit more on a decent pregnancy workout video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD was great for the second half of my pregnancy! It was a bit too easy for the first half, so I stuck to my collection of Prevention DVD's ...which are AMAZING! I have a few complaints about Fit and Firm Pregnancy. First, the dance moves in the aerobics segment are lame. I did not not really feel like doing the cha cha with my big belly! Denise claims that the video will help maintain your body during pregnancy, but my arms got flabby towards my last weeks. I will admit that I did not gain weight in my thighs or hips, so that was a plus. Denise's voice is annoying, and because i was irritable through my pregnancy it bugged me. There is part where Denise gleefully says "you will get back into your jeans in no time". I found this to be deceitful and harmful. Ladies, the truth is that it will take awhile for most of us to get back into our jeans! Unless you are graced with amazing genes, you will have to wear a size or two larger for awhile. And that is OK! I understand that we feel pressure from the media. Look at Nicole Ritchie. A month after giving birth she looked like a skeleton again. J.Lo had twins and was back to her old figure shortly. It seems as if Hollywood starlets are going on weight loss plans with in weeks of having babies, and that is not healthy. It is highly recommended that you wait at least 6 weeks to start up an exercise program. I just went to the doctors and my physician informed me that our bodies take up to a year to recover after the baby is born. We shouldn't go on crazy diets or weight loss plans. Take care of yourself. Eat a healthy balanced diet. A good plan to follow is Weight Watchers. Give yourself a year and a half to get back down to your original jean size. And if you don't get there, who cares...just be proud of yourself for being healthy! One more thing, I do love the pilates portion of this DVD. You should out Denise's Pilates For Every Body book. Its great for postpartum work outs. Plus, she has a good diet plan in there and helpful inspirational quotes. Another plus, you do not have to hear her voice :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: The cardio on this DVD is fine and is nice to do on days when the weather is not good enough to take a walk outdoors or I feel like changing it up from the treadmill or elliptical.That being said, that's really the only good thing about this DVD.  I mean it was fun, but the toning section was way too easy.  Not enough reps to fully work the muscles.  Much better DVD's to get a solid prenatal workout are:  The perfect pregnancy workout with Karyne Steben, Summer Sanders' Prenantal workout, & Suzanne Bowen's Long & Lean Prenantal workout.  I owned all of those before purchasing this DVD, but wanted something different to change up my routine.  Maybe I should of passed.
summary: Great for beginners, but not challenging enough for me
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a little tougher than a warm up but it is good. The idea is to keep moving. I am still sweating by the time I am done.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a moderate exerciser who worked out 4-5 times per week before my pregnancy.  I'm not a big fan of Denise Austin's, but as far as prenatal DVDs go, hers is pretty good!  I skip the first segment (5 minute breathing)& shoot right for the workout.  There is a 20-minute cardio (for all 3 trimesters) and 20-minute strength segments (one for 1st & 2nd trimesters and one for 3rd trimester).  If you don't have much experience in exercise, this is perfect.  I imagine as I get bigger, this will become more of a challenge.  It's a great pick-me-up & worth the time & money.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a good video and very helpful. Bad: if you are overdue you should watch this to start your labor, if you are high risk don't buy this video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I didn't try this video out until my 3rd trimester and I am not in particularly good shape but I do want to actually feel like I am getting exercise if I am doing an exercise DVD.  As an aside, I only did the 3rd trimester toning part of the video, which is about 20 mins long.  The video includes a toning section for each trimester and then a cardio section for the whole pregnancy.  The 3rd trimester toning section was really easy and more like stretching that actual exercising.  I did the whole 20 mins even though it felt pretty much like a waste of time.  You are better off just doing a yoga or stretching video where you can actually get some deep stretching in as opposed to this DVD.  Granted, I didn't try the cardio section, I just figured it would be way to easy so I didn't even bother.I would recommend getting something a little tougher if you really want exercise - I'm not sure what that it yet.  I have found some really great prenatal yoga DVDs but no really good exercise DVDs yet.  I do really want to try Summer Saunders DVD though.  Look for my review in the future.
summary: Way too easy - even in the 3rd trimester
Title: N/A

reviewText: Those who are somewhat new to working out and want to get some exercise to look and/or feel better during pregnancy will definitely benefit from this workout, which is easy to follow and do. You'll feel refreshed and stretched after doing it. Exercise is the best cure for aching bones and muscles during pregnancy! And as Denise will remind you at least 30 times, "You're doing something good for yourself AND your baby."If you've been more active throughout your pregnancy, though, you should be warned that this workout is basically the equivalent of the warm-up you would do before a non-pregnancy workout. You do a lot of the step-touch type moves that you would get in a typical aerobics warm-up. Of course, there's only so much you can safely do when you're pregnant, so a lot of the moves are repetitive and can get boring. But in the end, the idea is to get your body moving, and it does accomplish that.I didn't get this DVD until my 3rd trimester, and I enjoyed it. I felt like I got a good, basic, safe workout. But I don't think the cardio section would would have been enough of a challenge during my 1st and 2nd trimesters.
Title: N/A

reviewText: OK, so this is not the most challenging workout.  It's true.  If you suffer from occasional lethargy, though, it's upbeat and enough movement to get you going for the day.At first, I couldn't help but be annoyed.  I've never been one for the chirpy, talking-all-the-time, fitness guru, but I'll make an exception for Denise Austin.  She is like a caricature of herself, and on those days you're just not feeling it, I find it hard not to smile.  She's really giving it her all to make you feel "fit and firm" and stay "feeling good."  It's a non-stop pep-talk through some low-impact aerobic movements.  I also find it charming during the core segment where she acknowledges her own challenges with putting weight on her thighs during pregnancy.  It's very real, and very human.  It's not a relaxing video, but I can't help but feel better about myself after I'm done with it.Some of the exercises take a bit more coordination than I could muster, but if you let yourself just go with it, and not worry so much about your dance moves, it can be quite fun.This video is definitely on the conservative side as far as strenuousness, but it could be a good every-day workout if you're not easily bored and just want to stay moving through your pregnancy.
summary: Can't Help Smiling and Feeling Good
Title: N/A

reviewText: Denise is still her over-the-top excited fitness guru, but this workout is so much better than her other prenatal video.  Denise is not pregnant in this one, but uses women in various trimesters.  The workouts are varied and, with a little modification, I can really feel challenged when I'm done.  I enjoy it, the music is good, the stage/setup is good, and I would actually recommend this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by this workout dvd. It is an excellent production, well cued, and perfectly paced for pregnant women. I love the 20 min low impact cardio segment that can be used in all 3 trimesters (there is even a lower impact modification shown), and that you can choose which toning segment to do based on your stage of pregnancy. I'm not normally a Denise fan, but this one is really good!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout was great for me.  I like Denise Austin's perkiness and she has models in each stage of pregnancy which are nice to see.  The cardio workout is the best and the toning are not so good-I usually alternate the cardio on days I don't do Leisa Hart's fitmama salsa dance just to keep my cardio up and I do Pilates During Pregnancy or yoga for toning.  The cardio section though has nice stretches and it's very safe for pregnancy and after doing it you'll wish she had included another cardio session on the dvd
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have one other Denise Austin video, and although she tends to annoy me, her other video was a great workout, so I thought I would try it.  I really enjoyed it!  It is a good, fun workout and its seems safe and moderate.  I enjoy the fact that there are other women who are in various levels of their pregnancy, so there are modifications to it.  I look forward to doing the 20 minute cardio section throughout my whole pregnancy and look forward to using both the trimester additional workouts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The exercises are good but I cannot handle Denise Austin's insane perkiness for very long.  I always have to watch it first, then go back and mute her annoying commentary while I do the workout.  The workout itself is pretty good, though... you can amp it up or tone it down as you see fit.  My doctor says anything that bounces your chest is too bouncy for your uterus, so I'm able to modify the routine to fit this rule and still feel like I've done something good for myself.
Title: N/A
